It is assumed that this question relates to the Melbourne metropolitan omnibus routes, Nos. 1 and 2. In this case Commonwealth policy is involved as the two routes concerned have been re-organized by the Victorian Directorate of Emergency Road Transport in pursuance of a Commonwealth-wide policy under which comparable services previously operated through to city areas had been shortened and converted to feeder services connecting with railway and tramway services. Extensive re-organization of this kind was also undertaken in Sydney and the objective is to conserve valuable bus plant for vital services.
